timeline.bodyText:
This should be quoted and have a space before "${ALLUXIO_JAVA_OPTS}"

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              ALLUXIO_FUSE_JAVA_OPTS+=${ALLUXIO_JAVA_OPTS}
          
          
            
               ALLUXIO_FUSE_JAVA_OPTS+=" ${ALLUXIO_JAVA_OPTS}"
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText: It is simpler to say AlluxioFuse is not running
timeline.author: ZacBlanco
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -109,7 +109,8 @@ fuse_stat() {
   fi
   local fuse_info=$("${jps}" | grep AlluxioFuse)
   if [[ -z ${fuse_info} ]]; then
-    echo "AlluxioFuse: not running"
+    echo "No running AlluxioFuse process is found."

timeline.bodyText: "dismount" is not really a good  word to use in this context. Just say unmount
timeline.author: ZacBlanco
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -118,7 +119,19 @@ fuse_stat() {
   fi
 }
 
-USAGE_MSG="Usage:\n\talluxio-fuse [mount|umount|stat]"
+USAGE_MSG="Usage:\n\talluxio-fuse [mount|umount|stat]
+
+mount \tmount an Alluxio path to local file system
+umount \tdismount an Alluxio path from local file system

timeline.bodyText: I think adding the tab in Usage: \t... is unnecessary. The usage statement isn't in a table format. It will also probably be better for line length to just use a single space. Either that or use \n\t. It seems to be the format of most GNU coreutils (cp, rm, mv, mount, etc..)
timeline.author: ZacBlanco
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -118,7 +119,19 @@ fuse_stat() {
   fi
 }
 
-USAGE_MSG="Usage:\n\talluxio-fuse [mount|umount|stat]"
+USAGE_MSG="Usage:\n\talluxio-fuse [mount|umount|stat]
+
+mount \tmount an Alluxio path to local file system
+umount \tdismount an Alluxio path from local file system
+stat \tshow status of Alluxio mount points
+"
+
+MOUNT_USAGE="Usage: \talluxio-fuse mount [-n] [-o <mount option>] <mount_point> [alluxio_path]

timeline.bodyText:
sorry, just noticed this typo 🙃

                echo "AlluxioFuse process is not runing."
          
          
            
                echo "AlluxioFuse process is not running."
timeline.author: ZacBlanco
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -109,7 +109,8 @@ fuse_stat() {
   fi
   local fuse_info=$("${jps}" | grep AlluxioFuse)
   if [[ -z ${fuse_info} ]]; then
-    echo "AlluxioFuse: not running"
+    echo "AlluxioFuse process is not runing."
